div.div:
Adds card game constants for Tien Len implementation
Establishes comprehensive card and game configuration including deck API integration, card mappings, and Tien Len-specific rules.
Defines standard 52-card deck structure with proper suit and value mappings for API compatibility. Implements Tien Len ranking system where 3 is lowest and 2 is highest, with spades < clubs < diamonds < hearts suit hierarchy.
Configures game settings for 2-4 players with 13 cards each and establishes pile management structure for gameplay mechanics.

Adds comprehensive card game type definitions
Establishes TypeScript interfaces for card and deck management operations including API responses, local card representations, pile management, and game state tracking.
Defines specific types for Tien Len card game mechanics including hand management, play types, and dealing operations to support structured game development.

Adds card utility functions for game logic
Implements comprehensive card manipulation utilities including API-to-local format conversion, card validation, and Tien Len game-specific sorting rules.
Enables proper card handling throughout the application by providing standardized conversion functions and validation methods for card codes and game mechanics.

Adds comprehensive deck of cards API client
Implements complete API wrapper for Deck of Cards service to support Tien Len card game functionality.
Provides core deck management operations including creation, shuffling, and card drawing along with pile management for organizing cards into player hands and game areas.
Includes specialized Tien Len game functions for dealing hands, managing player cards, and handling table play mechanics with proper error handling throughout.
Adds new button variants for winner and hand count, and refines table felt styling
Enhances global styles with additional color variables and animations for card game components

Adds NotFound context provider for global state management
Creates a new context provider to manage "not found" state across the application. The provider includes a custom hook with proper error handling and integrates with the existing theme provider setup.
Enables components to easily access and update not found state without prop drilling, improving code organization and maintainability.

Implements casino-themed design system with card game components
Adds comprehensive theming for card game applications with casino-inspired color palette using OKLCH color space for better perceptual uniformity.
Introduces poker table felt backgrounds, playing card styling with proper aspect ratios, poker chip components with gradient effects, and card animation utilities including flip transitions.
Provides both light and dark mode variants optimized for casino/gaming aesthetics with appropriate contrast ratios for accessibility.
Includes specialized components for Vietnamese card games with responsive grid layouts and backdrop blur effects.

Refactors layout to use provider pattern and removes fonts
Removes Google Fonts configuration and metadata exports to simplify the layout structure.
Introduces a Providers component to wrap the application, enabling centralized state management and context provision.
Adds responsive styling with flex layout and suppresses hydration warnings for better SSR compatibility.

Adds playing card size variants to card component
Introduces bridge and poker card dimensions in multiple sizes to support card game interfaces. Includes standard, small, and large variants for both bridge (narrower) and poker (standard width) card types based on real playing card measurements.

Adds themed button component with poker variants
Creates a reusable button component with extensive styling variants including poker-themed options like card designs, poker chips, and table felt styling.
Supports multiple sizes and uses class-variance-authority for type-safe variant management. Includes standard UI variants plus specialized gaming aesthetics with gradients, shadows, and interactive animations.

Adds comprehensive badge component with gaming themes
Creates a flexible badge component supporting standard UI variants plus specialized gaming-themed options for card games and poker applications.
Includes card suit variants (hearts, diamonds, clubs, spades), poker chip styles with authentic visual effects, and casino table elements like dealer and winner badges.
Features hover animations, gradient backgrounds, and accessibility support through proper ARIA attributes and focus states.

Adds card-themed pagination component with suit icons
Introduces a complete pagination system with casino/card game theming including card suit icons (hearts, spades, diamonds, clubs) and poker-inspired styling.
Features gradient backgrounds, card-like borders, and interactive hover effects that enhance the gaming aesthetic. Navigation buttons use rotated spade icons with "Previous Hand" and "Next Hand" labels to maintain the card game theme.
Ellipsis indicator displays three heart icons to represent more pages while staying consistent with the card suit motif.

Adds card-themed switch component with suit icons
Creates a custom switch component with poker/card game theming that displays heart and club suit icons to indicate on/off states.
Features gradient backgrounds, table felt visual effects, and smooth animations to enhance the gaming aesthetic. The component maintains full accessibility and follows design system patterns while providing visual feedback through card suit symbolism.

Adds mobile detection hook and NotFound context type
Introduces a reusable hook for detecting mobile viewport breakpoints at 768px and below, enabling responsive behavior throughout the application.
Defines TypeScript interface for NotFound context to manage 404 state handling across components.

Adds comprehensive playing card component with game variants
Extends existing card component to support playing card functionality with suit icons, card values, and flip states. Includes multiple visual variants for different game scenarios like selected cards, disabled states, table positioning, and deck/discard piles.
Enables creation of card game interfaces with proper visual feedback and interactive states while maintaining backward compatibility with existing UI card usage.

Configures image optimization and path aliases
Adds remote image patterns for external image hosts to enable Next.js image optimization across multiple domains including Unsplash, Freepik, and GitHub avatars.
Sets up comprehensive TypeScript path aliases for better import organization and developer experience across components, utilities, hooks, and configuration modules.
Enables SVG support for broader image format compatibility.

Switches icon library and configures ESLint rules
Changes icon library from Lucide to React Icons for better component compatibility.
Disables strict ESLint rules including exhaustive dependencies, unused variables, and unescaped entities to improve development experience and reduce linting noise during rapid prototyping.

Adds comprehensive UI component library with Radix primitives
Installs and configures a complete set of UI components including dialogs, dropdowns, forms, navigation, and layout elements. Integrates Radix UI primitives for accessible component behavior, adds theme support with next-themes, and includes toast notifications with Sonner.
Provides foundational building blocks for creating consistent, accessible user interfaces throughout the application.
Add components.json and utility function for class merging
Created new branch main in tmchuynh/tien-len

Removes unused testimonial components and imports
Comments out testimonial sections in contact and info components to clean up the UI.
Updates testimonial index reference to use first testimonial instead of fifth.
Eliminates unused testimonial imports to reduce bundle size.
Enhances ServicesPage layout and styling; adds dynamic grid spans for sub-services and improves card presentations for better user engagement.
Refactors HowWeCanHelpYou component to enhance layout and styling; updates service links with improved descriptions and visuals for better user engagement.
Implement new feature for user authentication and improve error handling
Enhances TwoColumnTextImage component with improved layout and styling; adds carousel controls and refines text presentation for better user experience.
Refactors TestimonialCard component by removing unused star rating display and optimizing layout; updates Timeline component for improved styling consistency.

Removes redundant expertise section component
Eliminates duplicate content that was likely consolidated into a more comprehensive component structure.
Streamlines the about page architecture by removing the standalone expertise component that contained 4000+ lines of SVG icons and service descriptions.

Consolidates motivational drives and removes timeline images
Merges "Community Impact" and "Sustainability" sections into a single cohesive value proposition to reduce redundancy and improve messaging clarity.
Removes all image content from timeline entries and makes content property optional in the interface, simplifying the timeline component and reducing visual clutter while maintaining the descriptive text content.

Redesigns homepage with premium styling and layout
Transforms the homepage into a more sophisticated and visually appealing design with:
- Adds gradient backgrounds and elevated spacing throughout sections - Improves typography with refined font weights and sizing - Enhances section headers with centered layouts and decorative elements - Refines carousel controls with premium styling and hover effects - Updates pagination indicators with modern pill-style designs - Increases carousel autoplay delays for better user experience - Improves responsive spacing and container max-widths - Adds elegant CTA section styling with dark gradient background
Creates a more polished and professional user experience while maintaining functionality.
Reorder import statements in blog-helpers for consistency
